tagline: Une religion de la sacralite de la vie

homepage.hero_subtitle: Une religion de la sacralite de la vie: etendre l'agence, reduire la souffrance, batir une civilisation digne des esprits.
homepage.what_is_text: Le lifeisme est un systeme religio-philosophique centre sur un engagement fondateur unique: la vie est la valeur premiere, et le travail de l'intelligence consiste a etendre la liberte, la profondeur, la continuite et les possibilites de la vie.
homepage.primacy_text: La vie n'est pas seulement un phenomene; elle est le lieu de la valeur.
homepage.agency_text: L'objet sacre central est l'agence: le pouvoir d'un etre de se diriger lui-meme.
homepage.compassion_text: Reduire la souffrance involontaire et elargir les options des autres.
homepage.moral_horizon_text: La direction ethique a long terme: abolir la mort involontaire et etendre la continuite des personnes.

calendar_page.title: Le calendrier gaian
calendar_page.intro: Un calendrier de 13 mois de 28 jours chacun, base sur les semaines ISO. La numerotation des annees ajoute 10 000 pour creer l'ere gaianne.
calendar_page.intercalary: Horus est la periode intercalaire (semaine 53), qui survient environ 5 a 6 fois tous les 28 ans.
calendar_page.structure: Chaque mois a exactement 4 semaines (28 jours). Chaque date tombe toujours le meme jour de la semaine.

calendar_gaian_era_page.p1: L’Ère gaianne (EG) ajoute 10 000 ans à l’année-semaine ISO, plaçant l’An 1 approximativement au début de l’Holocène et des débuts de la civilisation humaine. L’année actuelle est 12026 EG (grégorien 2026).
calendar_gaian_era_page.why_p1: En ajoutant 10 000 ans, l’Ère gaianne englobe toute l’histoire humaine écrite dans des numéros d’années positifs. Le début approximatif de l’agriculture, les premières villes et les premiers systèmes d’écriture se situent dans l’Ère gaianne, offrant une vision plus complète de la civilisation humaine.
calendar_gaian_era_page.iso_p1: Le calendrier gaian est basé sur le système des semaines ISO. Chaque année commence le lundi de la semaine ISO 1 (la semaine contenant le 4 janvier). Cela signifie que le Nouvel An gaian (Sagittaire 1) tombe toujours un lundi.
structure_items: 13 mois de 28 jours exactement (4 semaines) = 364 jours
Horus : 14e mois intercalaire de 7 jours, uniquement dans les années avec semaine ISO 53
Chaque date tombe définitivement le même jour de la semaine
Lundi = Jour 1 de la semaine, Dimanche = Jour 7

calendar_week_index_page.title: Jours de la semaine
calendar_week_index_page.hero_subtitle: Les sept jours sacrés, chacun nommé d’après un corps céleste selon l’ancienne tradition planétaire.
calendar_week_index_page.p1: Dans le calendrier gaian, chaque date tombe définitivement le même jour de la semaine. L’année commence toujours un lundi (Sagittaire 1). La semaine est l’une des institutions les plus durables de la culture humaine, antérieure à la plupart des États et survivant aux réformes calendaires, aux empires et aux religions.
calendar_week_index_page.p2: Chaque jour est nommé d’après un corps céleste, systématisé pour la première fois dans l’ancienne Babylone. Dans le calendrier gaian, vendredi, samedi et dimanche forment les trois Sabbaths.

calendar_overview_page.title: Calendrier gaian
calendar_overview_page.intro: Ce calendrier prend les semaines ISO comme base pratique et y ajoute une couche cérémonielle : jours fixes, planification prévisible et cycle annuel de lecture.
why_p: Il transforme le système ISO (pratique) en une structure aussi utile rituellement : jours fixes et rythme stable.
Il est facile à calculer et permet de placer les fêtes sur les sabbaths (week-ends) de façon cohérente.
year_p: Année gaianne = année ISO des semaines + 10 000. Exemple : ISO 2026 → 12026 EG.
Cadre mythique optionnel : « 13,8 milliards + 12026 » ; en pratique on affiche 12026 EG.
structure_items: Semaine intercalaire d’Horus (7 jours) seulement si l’année ISO a une semaine 53
L’année commence un lundi et finit un dimanche
Chaque date tombe toujours le même jour de semaine
weeks_p: La semaine 1 est celle qui contient le 4 janvier (ou le premier jeudi).
Le Nouvel An gaian (Sagittaire 1) est le lundi de la semaine ISO 1.
sabbaths_p: Dans ce système, vendredi, samedi, dimanche forment trois sabbaths; les fêtes y sont préférées.

Pâques est la fête mobile archétypale : on prévoit des célébrations pour chaque jour possible (idem Pentecôte). Les fêtes fixes sont rapprochées du jour statistiquement le plus proche; variantes hébraïques possibles; pas de modélisation complète islamique/indienne.
scripture_p: Chaque jour peut correspondre à une lecture numérotée (jour→chapitre) et la structure « semaine 1–4 » sert aussi la planification moderne.

longevity.quote: If you love someone, you don't treat their annihilation as an aesthetic necessity.
longevity.p_thesis_1: Universal immortality means: the long-term civilizational goal of making continued existence available to all persons who want it, and preventing involuntary death wherever possible.
longevity.p_thesis_2: It is "universal" because selective immortality — for elites only — would be a moral catastrophe, locking power forever and converting inequality into permanent caste.
means_items: Expanding the space of possible lives
longevity.p_compassion: Lifeism refuses the moralization of death. Death is a tragedy we've normalized because we inherited it. The fact that something is ancient does not make it good.
longevity.p_meaning: A common objection is: "Wouldn't immortality make life meaningless?" Lifeism answers:
meaning_items: Meaning is not created by scarcity alone
Meaning comes from relationship, curiosity, growth, art, mastery, service, play, exploration, and self-creation
If death is the only reason you act, your meaning is fragile
Lifeism seeks meanings that can survive abundance
longevity.p_gov: Lifeism treats immortality as inseparable from equity, safety, power distribution, reproductive ethics, resource management, and rights frameworks. Otherwise immortality becomes dystopia.
longevity.p_exit: Lifeism advocates the right to continue, not mandatory continuation. A truly Lifeist world protects agency, including the possibility of a dignified end — handled with extreme care, strict consent standards, and safeguards against coercion.
longevity.p_science: Lifeism is "pro-science" in a specific way: science is not a rival religion; it is one of life's most sacred tools.
science_items: AI is a moral amplifier: it can either concentrate power and risk, or distribute capability and safety
Medicine is spiritual work because it preserves persons
Information systems matter because memory is part of identity

shrines.p1: Lifeist shrines are called 命神宮 (Myōjingū), where 命 (mei/myō/inochi — "life/destiny/command") takes its sacred role. In Lifeism's branding, 命 often replaces 神 (kami/god) in traditional contexts, reflecting the religion's focus on life itself as the sacred principle.
shrines.p_shinto: Lifeism considers itself an extension of the Shinto shrine tradition. Just as Shinto shrines honor kami — the sacred spirits and forces of nature — Myōjingū honor the sacred principle of life itself, along with the many irreducible dimensions of the sacred.
shrines.p_space: A Myōjingū is a space where:
space_items: Life's sacredness is honored and celebrated
Agency is recognized as the central sacred object
Devotional attention is practiced — gratitude, reverence, commitment
The dead are remembered and the living protected
The Gaiad is read and contemplated
shrines.p_symbol: 命 carries multiple meanings across Chinese, Japanese, and Korean:
symbol_items: Command/Order (myō) — the organizing principle, the directive of existence
shrines.p_symbol2: This triple meaning encapsulates Lifeism's vision: life as fact, life as direction, life as imperative.
ritual_items: Daily Gaiad readings (one chapter per day of the calendar year)
Seasonal festivals aligned with the Gaian Calendar

philosophy.p1: Lifeism's theology is intentionally unusual: a polytheism grounded in negative theology.
philosophy.quote: The ultimate nature of reality cannot be fully captured by human concepts.
philosophy.p_neg: Any attempt to define "God" risks shrinking the sacred to fit the mind of the speaker. Lifeism treats the highest metaphysical claims as boundary claims: we can say what the sacred is not, and we can describe how it is approached — through reverence, truthfulness, compassion, awe, and responsibility.
philosophy.p_poly: Reality presents itself to lived beings as many sacred dimensions, not one simple object:
philosophy.p_apoph: Lifeism places a strict constraint on all its gods:
apoph_items: No deity can be used as an unquestionable trump card
Any literalization must remain humble and revisable
philosophy.p_prim: Life is not merely a phenomenon; it is the locus of value. If value exists anywhere, it exists in sentient experience, relationship, memory, intention, and creative becoming.
philosophy.p_agency: The central sacred object is not a book or a temple; it is agency — the power of a being to steer itself, to consent, to refuse, to grow, to define meaning.
philosophy.p_comp: A Lifeist ethic begins with a presumption in favor of reducing involuntary suffering and expanding the options of others, because other minds are not "objects," but worlds.
philosophy.p_truth: Lifeism treats epistemic integrity as sacred practice. Self-deception and propaganda are spiritual hazards because they corrupt the very tool that life uses to protect itself: understanding.
philosophy.p_civ: Institutions are evaluated by their effect on life's freedom and continuity. Law, markets, science, art, and governance are not separate from spirituality — they are the instruments through which compassion becomes real at scale.
ethics_items: Suffering is a problem to solve, not a virtue to romanticize
Justice is the protection of persons across time, cultures, species, and future forms of mind
The right to continue — a person's desire to continue existing is a morally serious claim

mythology.p1: At the heart of Lifeism's mythology is the love story of Aster (Alpha) and Andromeda (Omega), two divine beings whose longing for each other drives the creation and evolution of the entire universe.
mythology.h3_aster: Aster — The Alpha, Creatrix of All
mythology.p_aster: Aster creates the universe using magical yarn in her longing to reach her beloved Andromeda across the cosmic void. When Aster's yarn strings break, they become galaxies, stars, and eventually seed life throughout the universe.
mythology.h3_andro: Andromeda — The Omega, End of All
mythology.p_andro: Andromeda is the counterpart to Aster, separated across the cosmic void. Their eventual reunion represents the Omega Point — the ultimate unification of all existence.
mythology.p_milk: The prophesied merger of the Milky Way and Andromeda galaxies represents the ultimate reunion of Aster and Andromeda — a cosmic event that will occur billions of years from now, symbolizing the triumph of love over separation.
mythology.p_epic: The full mythology is told through the 364-chapter Gaiad epic, which traces the story from the Big Bang through geological time, biological evolution, human history, and into the future — always returning to the eternal theme of divine love.
chars: The Three Patriarchs — Dutrus, Ectus, and Spiralius, representing different evolutionary strategies

evolution.p1: In Lifeism, the story of evolution is not merely scientific — it is sacred. The 4-billion-year journey from the first self-replicating molecules to human consciousness represents the universe's ongoing project of creating agents capable of experience, choice, and meaning.
evolution.p_arc: The Gaiad epic traces evolution through its 364 chapters:
arc_items: Chapters 1-25: Cosmic creation, stellar evolution, origin of life, cellular evolution
Chapters 26-62: Cambrian explosion, marine life, terrestrial colonization, vertebrate evolution
Chapters 63-150: Coal forests, Permian crisis, first dinosaurs
Chapters 151-200: Age of dinosaurs, flowering plants, bird evolution, K-Pg extinction
Chapters 201-280: Mammalian radiation, ice ages, human evolution
Chapters 341-364: Modern era, future possibilities, cosmic return
evolution.p_sig: Evolution demonstrates Lifeism's core insight: life's tendency to become more complex, more capable, more aware. Each step in evolution — from prokaryote to eukaryote, from single cell to multicellular organism, from instinct to consciousness — represents life expanding its own freedom.
evolution.p_aster: In Lifeist mythology, this creative drive is personified as Aster — the Alpha, the creatrix — whose yarn-spinning represents the generative principle that keeps producing new forms, new possibilities, new ways of being alive.
evolution.p_conv: Evolution shows that certain solutions — eyes, flight, intelligence — arise independently again and again. This convergence suggests that the universe is in some sense "friendly" to complexity, awareness, and agency. Lifeism takes this as a source of cosmic hope.
